intro: Hirtella thouarsiana subsp. thouarsiana, commonly known as the Madagascar hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are often borne on short peduncles. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
